snippet: With evidence that powerful new weapons are flowing to both the Syrian government and opposition fighters, the uprising has thrust the Obama administration into a difficult position.
abstract: There is evidence that powerful weapons are flowing to both the Syrian government and opposition fighters, thrusting the Obama administration into an increasingly difficult position as the conflict shows signs of mutating into a full-fledged civil war; United States believes that Russia is providing the Syrian government with attack helicopters, which are needed to combat the increasingly well-funded opposition forces, who are being supported by neighboring Arab nations.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and NEIL MacFARQUHAR
byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Washington, and Neil MacFarquhar from Beirut, Lebanon. Reporting was contributed by Thom Shanker and Eric Schmitt from Washington, Ellen Barry from Moscow, and Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul.
